%%%>
\usepackage{pgfplots}
\usepackage{pgfplotstable}
\pgfplotsset{width=7cm,compat=1.8}
\begin{comment}
:Title: Scatter Plot
:Tags: PGFPlotstable;Mathematics;Manual
:Author: Christian Feuersänger
:Slug: scatter-plot

We want to generate a scatter plot: assume that we are given a couple of
special (x; y) coordinates along with color data at every vertex. We would
like to draw markers at the positions and choose individual colors
depending on the color data.

The code is from the PGFPlots 1.10 manual:
"3.4 Use Cases involving Scatter Plots".
\end{comment}
\begin{document}
\begin{tikzpicture}
\begin{axis}[
	enlargelimits=false,
	colorbar,
]
\addplot+[
	only marks,
	scatter,
	point meta={ln(1e-6+abs(\thisrow{f(x)}))/ln(10)},
	mark size=0.6pt,
]
table
	{concat_VV_together_grid.dat};
\end{axis}
\end{tikzpicture}
\end{document}
